snippet: The government also asked for penalties against Rebecca Mairone, a former midlevel executive at Bank of America’s Countrywide Financial unit.
abstract: United States government asks that Bank of America pay $863.6 million in damages after federal jury finds it liable for fraud over defective mortgages sold by its Countrywide Financial unit; also asks for penalties against Rebecca Mairone, former midlevel executive at Country Financial.
lead_paragraph: The government also asked for penalties against Rebecca Mairone, a former midlevel executive at Bank of America’s Countrywide Financial unit.

headline.main: U.S. Seeks $864 Million From Bank Over Poor Loans
headline.print_headline: U.S. Seeks $864 Million From Bank Over Poor Loans
